intro: Strongylodon celebicus, commonly known as the Celebes strongylodon, is a flowering plant native to the Maluku Islands of Indonesia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments within tropical rainforests. Its leaves are usually oval-shaped with a smooth surface and a slightly hairy texture. Strongylodon celebicus is not widely studied, but it is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
